This was the same woman who had reigned as the former .Nussbaum, "Kōken Tennō," pp. 547-548. ==Events of the Jingo-keiun era== * 28 August 770 (Jingo-keiun 4, 4th day of the 8th month): In the 5th year of Shōtoku's reign, the empress died; and she named Prince Shirakabe as her heir. The succession (senso) was received and soon after, Emperor Kōnin is said to have accepted the monarch's role and duties and powers (sokui).Titsingh, p. 81; Brown, p. 276; Imperial Household Agency (Kunaichō), (称徳天皇 (48); retrieved 2012-5-22. This was confirmed in ceremonies.Varley, p. 44; a distinct act of senso is unrecognized prior to Emperor Tenji; and all sovereigns except Jitō, Yōzei, Go-Toba, and Fushimi have senso and sokui in the same year until the reign of Emperor Go-Murakami. Compare Kunaichō, Ceremony of Accession (Sokui- no-Rei); retrieved 2012-5-22. The Jingō-kaihō' was a copper coin issued from 765 to 796.
